org.transitime.gtfs

Class PathProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.transitime.gtfs.PathProcessor

  • public class PathProcessor
extends java.lang.Object
    Part of GtfsData class. Processes the shapes.txt data and converts into the segments for the associated paths between the stops.
    Author:
    SkiBu Smith

    • Constructor Detail

      • PathProcessor

        public PathProcessor(java.util.List<GtfsShape> gtfsShapes,
             java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Stop> stopsMap,
             java.util.Collection<TripPattern> tripPatterns,
             double offsetDistance,
             double maxStopToPathDistance,
             double maxDistanceForEliminatingVertices,
             double maxSegmentLength)
        Parameters:
        gtfsShapes -
        stopsMap -
        tripPatterns -
        offsetDistance - How much to the right the paths should be offset. If negative then the paths are offset to the left. If 0.0 then of course the paths are not offset at all.
        maxSegmentLength - If segment is longer than this length than it will be divided into smaller segments so that this max length is not exceeded.

    • Method Detail

      • processPathSegments

        public void processPathSegments()
        Determines the path segments for each trip pattern. If shapes.txt GTFS file has a shape for the trip pattern then that data is used. Otherwise will simply connect the stops with straight line paths. When shapes.txt data is used a lot of processing is done. The path segments are offset orthogonally by the offsetDistance which is useful if the shapes.txt info is simply street centerline data. By offsetting the path segments for the different directions won't completely overlap on the map. Then the stops are matched to the shapes in order to create the Paths. Each path is for a separate stop and the path ends at the stop. The path segments are also filtered so that segments that are too short or too long are adjusted.
